pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
PROJECT: FLOATING SLAB
1715/48105 BONDISEY TDA (MD)
CLIENT: DWAYNE GOODYEAR
DRAWING TITLE:
NOTES, PLAN & SECTION(S)
DRAWN BY: CC DATE: 2023-03-03
DESIGN BY: NA SHEET NO.: S1
PROJECT NO.: 24-01-002
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
PREPARATION:
1. REMOVE ALL TOPSOIL AND ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE BUILDING AREA.
2. SLAB MUST BE CARRIED DOWN TO NATURAL UNDISTURBED SOIL CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING 1500 PSF (75 kPa) PRESSURE UNDER BEARING OF SLAB OR 1500 PSF (75 kPa) ALL OTHER STRUCTURES (ULTIMATE LOAD BEARING PRESSURE).
3. IF GRADE TO BE BUILT UP, GRANULAR FILL IS TO BE USED. COMPACTION TO MAXIMUM OF 98% S.P.D. OR AS MAY BE DETERMINED BY GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEER.
4. IF FILL IS USED, SOIL COMPACTION TO BE SUPERVISED BY GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEER.
5. UNLESS OTHERWISE SHOWN, DRAWINGS PROVIDE SUFFICIENT DATA TO CONSTRUCT FOUNDATION USING NORMAL BUILDING TRADE PRACTICES.
6. ENGINEER'S INSPECTION, IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING OVER TIME (IF BUILDING IS NOT HEATED) TO HEAT LOSS OF BUILDING (IF HEATED).
7. ENGINEER'S INSPECTION, IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING.
8. IF SLAB IS INSULATED, BRICK VENEER MAY BE USED UP TO MAXIMUM OF 4' ABOVE SLAB.
CLIENT CONTRACTOR TO CONFORM SLAB DIMENSIONS BEFORE ORDERING MATERIAL & STARTING CONSTRUCTION.
CONCRETE:
1. ALL CONCRETE ON THIS PROJECT SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 20 DAY COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 32 MPa WITH AIR ENTRAINMENT AND 0.40 MAX WATER-TO-CEMENT RATIO.
2. REINFORCEMENT TO BE GRADE 400R.
3. ALL REINFORCEMENT TO BE BAR SIZE 10M.
WELDED WIRE MESH 152M, 152M LAP 6".
4. PLACING OF CONCRETE SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE TO THE LATEST EDITION OF THE CANADIAN CONCRETE INSTITUTE (ACI 318-14/CSA A23.3-14) AND LOCAL BY-LAWS.
5. SLAB ON GRADE CONSTRUCTION:
   a) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS).
   b) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. SIDE OF THE FLOATING SLAB).
   c) SLAB ON GRADE SHALL BE FORMED WITH 6" GRANULAR FILL (COMPACTED TO 98% S.P.D.) ON COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A'.
6. SLAB ON GRADE AWAY FROM BUILDING.
7. SLAB IS SUITABLE TO SUPPORT 0.5 kPa. SPACING THICKNESS (1"?), SPACE SAW CUTS @ 19' o.c.
8. SLAB IS NOT TO BE POURED ON FROZEN GROUND.
9. SLAB IS...
pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet provides a detailed plan and sections for a floating slab foundation, including thickened edge details. It includes comprehensive general notes on preparation, concrete specifications, and reinforcement requirements. The plan view shows the overall dimensions of the slab as 40'-0" by 30'-0". The sections illustrate the construction details, including reinforcement and insulation. The sheet emphasizes the importance of proper preparation and inspection to prevent issues such as cracking or heaving.
